content: Singapore post-secondary school founded 1992This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Nanyang Polytechnic" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*‹ The template *Infobox university* is being considered for merging. › **Nanyang Polytechnic** (**NYP**), established in 1992, is a post-secondary education institution and statutory board under the purview of the [Ministry of Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Recognition This section **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources in this section. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Nanyang Polytechnic" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* Nanyang Polytechnic has won many awards and recognitions. These include: - Work-Life Achiever Award (2012) - Singapore Quality Award (2011) - Public Service Achievement Award (2010) - Innovation Excellence Award (2009) - SHRI Leading HR Practices in E-Human Resource Management Award (2009) - Hewitt Best Employer Award (2009) - [BCA](/wiki/Building_and_Construction_Authority) Green Mark Platinum Award (2005) - [ASEAN](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations) Energy Efficiency and Conservation Best Practices Competition (2004) - [ISO9001:2000](/wiki/ISO9001#2000_version) Certification (2001) - [ISO9001](/wiki/ISO9001) Certification (2000) - [ISO14001](/wiki/ISO14001) Certification (1999) - [ISO9002](/wiki/ISO9002) Certification (1996) ## Notable alumni This section **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources in this section. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Nanyang Polytechnic" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* ### Entertainment - [Romeo Tan](/wiki/Romeo_Tan), [Mediacorp](/wiki/Mediacorp) actor - [Carrie Wong](/wiki/Carrie_Wong), Mediacorp actress - [Chantalle Ng](/wiki/Chantalle_Ng), Mediacorp actress - [Hossan Leong](/wiki/Hossan_Leong), Singaporean actor - [Vanessa Peh](/wiki/Vanessa_Peh), Miss Singapore World 2018 - [Anupama Aura Gurung](/wiki/Anupama_Aura_Gurung), Miss Nepal Earth 2011 ### Sports - [Hariss Harun](/wiki/Hariss_Harun), footballer and [captain](/wiki/Captain_(association_football)) of the [Singapore national team](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team) - [Lionel Lewis](/wiki/Lionel_Lewis), former Singapore national team footballer - [Helena Wong](/wiki/Helena_Wong_(weightlifter)), Singaporean weightlifter - [Reuben Kee](/wiki/Reuben_Kee), Singaporean [dragon boat](/wiki/Dragon_boat) paddler - Official website 1°22′48″N 103°50′56″E﻿ / ﻿1.38000°N 103.84889°E﻿ / 1.38000; 103.84889
title: Nanyang Polytechnic
